item.title: From Slack to Snack: Replacing Critical Dependencies
item.description: It’s a story as old as time: your team is responsible for a major system feature that’s widely used, but it’s not just your code that makes it work. There’s a third-party dependency: an external platform, a database, a library — something that’s there seemingly for the long run. But one day, your team can no longer rely on that dependency. There can be many reasons for this, from performance to missing features to pricing.
